intro: Hackelia arida, commonly known as the desert honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to arid environments with deep roots for water absorption. Hackelia arida is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
